age_check.subtitle: Whether you want to restrict your study to participants aged 18 and above
age_check.text:
Part of the data quality checks.

By default the experiment will tell participants to not participate if they are under 18. You can turn this off with the value no.

audio_visual.subtitle: Checks whether participants can hear and see multimedia stimuli before starting.
audio_visual.text:
Part of the data quality checks.

Can be used to check audio and video browser settings and display basic problem solving instructions where necessary. If you only require an audio check, write audio. If you only require a video check, write video. To check both audio and video, write both (this is the default check). If you don't wish to include this check, write no.

buffer.subtitle: Number of trials you want buffered
buffer.text: By default, Collector will try to have 5 trials in advance loaded to try to make the experiment run as smoothly as possible. You can change this number to whatever number of trials you want to have in advance

counterbalance.subtitle: This allows you to use multiple 'Procedure' sheets, presented sequentially, from one 'Conditions' row
counterbalance.text:
It cycles through a list of procedure sheets to select the required the procedure sheet each time the study starts (resetting when all sheets have been presented, restarting the cycle). If anything goes wrong (e.g., connection cannot be made to the required files) it loads in the sheet listed in the 'procedure' column of the Conditions sheet (with participant(s) prompted to inform you that counterbalancing failed). The system counterbalances without replacement, so cannot adjust for participants who withdraw.

Implementation: click Counterbalance above the Conditions sheet (visible when there are 2+ procedure sheets). This will guide you through creating the PHP and CSV files required. Once generated and updated, upload both files to an external webhost (e.g., the UoR cPanel hosting) and add the full URL of the PHP file to this column.

description.subtitle: deprecated
description.text: please change this column header to name.

details_warning.subtitle: Warning participants about the types of information they provide during the experiment?
details_warning.text:
Part of the data quality checks.

Change this value to no if you do not wish to remind participants to consider any personal information they provide when completing your experiment.

download_at_end.subtitle: Can participant download at the end?
download_at_end.text: By default, participants will be able to download their data at the end of the experiment. This can be turned off if you don't want this. BUT YOU ALMOST CERTAINLY WANT THIS!!!!

end_message.subtitle: A message at the very end
end_message.text: This will replace the default message at the end (which includes their completion code). If you want the participant to see their completion code, do NOT have an end_message. Instead, have an instruct trial at the end of your procedure with whatever you want your last message to be to them, and let them proceed to the default end message and completion code.

forward_at_end.subtitle: Where should the participant go next?
forward_at_end.text: By default, the participant will not be prompted to complete any other links. However, if you want the participant to complete another link after your task then just write the link you want them to go to next in this column

fullscreen.subtitle: On or off?
fullscreen.text: By default, the experiment will NOT be in Fullscreen mode. Change this to on if you don't want this.

mobile.subtitle: Whether the user is allowed to use a mobile device
mobile.text: By default the user is allowed to use mobile devices - but you can add this column and write no and this will prevent them completing the study on one.

name.subtitle: Name of Condition
name.text: Please don't put any spaces in this name. You can use underscores _ instead though.

notes.subtitle: Just for you
notes.text: This doesn't do anything in the experiment, but you might find it useful for adding any notes you need for each condition.

participant_id.subtitle: Participants give their ID
participant_id.text: By default this will be set to on and participants will give a participant id (e.g. a Prolific Academic or MTurk ID) at the start of the experiment. Change this setting to either random (recommended) to generate a unique and randomised id for the user, or off (not recommended) for the participant to have the id 'notUnique'. The participant_id influences the name of their data file. If the participant does not put in an ID, they will skip the start_message.

procedure.subtitle: Which Procedure sheet?
procedure.text:
By default, your experiment will use procedure_1.csv, which is a list of the order of trials and settings for each trial. If you want different participants to have different procedures, you will need to create a new procedure sheet, and have separate rows in the condition sheet for each procedure.

If you are developing your experiments online (e.g. on open-collector.org or ocollector.org) ignore the following. If you are developing the experiment on your computer, you should your procedure sheet in the web/User/Projects/YOUR EXPERIMENT folder.

progress_bar.subtitle: Would you like a progress bar at the top?
progress_bar.text:
By default, your project will include a progress bar at the top that moves forward after each row within your procedure sheet is complete. However, you can change this setting in a few ways:
To make the progress bar go up after each trial or phase, you can change this column to say phase, trial, stimuli, item.

If you would like to turn off the progress bar, just change this cell to say off.

If you would like the progress bar to proceed in proportion to the number of rows (which is the default), then you can write row in this column.

redcap_url.subtitle: PhP file location
redcap_url.text: redcap_url is the location of the PhP file that acts as the bridge between Collector and REDCap when running a live experiment. Note: when an active link is present, data is sent to REDCap during both 'run' and 'preview' versions.

skip_quality.subtitle: Skips the data quality checks at the start
skip_quality.text: If you're building an interactive website rather than collecting data then putting 'yes' in this column can be helpful for a more natural experience.

start_message.subtitle: A message at the very start
start_message.text: This will replace the default message at the start of the experiment. If participant_id is on off or random then this message will be skipped. In this case, start your experiment with an instruct trial with the message you want to be the first thing the participant will see.

stimuli.subtitle: Which Stimuli sheet?
stimuli.text:
Stimuli sheets can used as a list of words or media files (images, audio, pictures) that your experiment will use. If you want different lists of stimuli, you need to create a new stimuli sheet.

If you are developing your experiments online (e.g. on open-collector.org or ocollector.org) ignore the following. If you are developing the experiment on your computer, you should your stimuli sheet in the web/User/Projects/YOUR EXPERIMENT folder.

welcome.subtitle: Allows you to customise the welcome message text
welcome.text:
Part of the data quality checks.

Entering a value in this column will alter the main body text that is displayed when a participants starts an experiment. You can parse html to format and style the welcome message to your requirements.

zoom_check.subtitle: Do you want the user to adjust the zoom in their browser to make it consistent between users?
zoom_check.text:
Part of the data quality checks.

By default the project will make users compare a card with one on the screen and adjust the one on screen until they are similar sizes. This can disrupt eye-tracking using webgazer though, so you might want to write no in this column to stop it in this sort of situation.
